children.text: The damp-proof course (DPC), where visible, has been installed too far back in from the front face of the brickwork, thereby only extending part-way across the width of the bricks.
Part 3.3.5.8 Damp-proof courses and flashings - installation of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that
‘Damp-proof courses and flashings must be located so as to form a continuous damp-proofing barrier around the bottom perimeter of walls where constructed on a concrete slab’ .
Additionally, Australian Standard AS 4773.2 Masonry in Small Buildings, requires that

‘Damp-proof Courses (DPCs) will be installed in masonry walls where required to form a continuous damp-proofing barrier around the building; of sufficient width to extend through the entire masonry leaf; and visible at the face of the wall, including after rendering or any other applied coatings’.
The placement of the damp-proof course will have to be rectified to stop the long-term occurrence of rising damp.
